p: The viruses associated to a waterborne transmission are enteric viruses, it means that they infect the cells of the intestinal tract and are excreted in the feces of infected persons. These viruses pose significant problems in terms of public health; they are responsible for gastroenteritis, hepatitis, paralysis, meningitis, or respiratory diseases. These viruses are excreted in large quantities through fecal and will contaminate the environment; they can be transmitted by water route or during the consumption of contaminated food.
